Uses of Package
peregrine.util.netty

Packages that use peregrine.util.netty
peregrine Main peregrine package including core interfaces for writing jobs. 
peregrine.client.proto Wire protocol for GET/SCAN/PUT responses from the region servers. 
peregrine.controller Main interface for the controller which allows one to kick off and execute jobs in the cluster. 
peregrine.http A new and cleaner HTTP client that doesn't require an extra queue and uses isWritable correctly. 
peregrine.io.chunk Code for dealing which chunks (which are fragments of partition files). 
peregrine.io.partition Code for writing partition files which are automatically written to the correct hosts and split into chunks. 
peregrine.io.sstable Disk-based SSTable implementation supporting indexes and checksums. 
peregrine.os Operating system specific extentions including mlock, fadvise, fallocate, etc. 
peregrine.shuffle Generic shuffle data parsing functionality. 
peregrine.util Util classes for use (crypto, queues, etc). 
peregrine.util.netty Extensions and additional code for using Netty and async IO. 
peregrine.worker Worker daemon including PFS (partitioned filesystem) support as well as main daemon interface (RPC, etc). 
peregrine.worker.clientd.requests Code related to request handling. 
 

Classes in peregrine.util.netty used by peregrine
ByteReadable
          Read one byte at a time and advance the current position.

          Tag interface for anything that can accept the write of a channel buffer.

          Provides general services and infrastructure for peregrine daemons (worker and controller).

          Some additional functionality for channel handlers required for Peregrine.
